alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Northeast Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 29 at 2:53PM MDT until March 31 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT 11 AM TO 9 PM THURSDAY FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY, SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS BELOW SNOWPACK AND ALL OF EASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Widespread critical fire weather conditions will return Thursday across much of central and eastern New Mexico below snowpack. Very strong southwest winds, low relative humidity values, near to above normal temperatures, and a high Haines index are expected. Relative humidity values may drop into the single digits for several hours Thursday afternoon. Critical fire weather conditions return Friday across the eastern plains though temperatures will not be as high. Nonetheless, very strong westerly winds and low humidity values are expected. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 9 PM MDT THURSDAY... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT FRIDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon to 8 PM MDT Friday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the Northeast Plains (Zone 104) and East Central Plains (Zone 126) late Thursday morning through Thursday evening and again Friday afternoon through Friday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 35 to 45 with gusts near 65 mph on Thursday. West to northwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts near 60 mph on Friday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values dropping to between 6 to 10 percent Thursday afternoon and between 10 and 15 percent Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly and will be hard to control. Long range spotting and extreme fire behavior will be possible. Outdoor burning should not be done.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
